intro: Hibbertia leucocrossa, commonly known as the white-cross hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with white markings. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Hibbertia leucocrossa produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in the southeastern regions of Australia. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
